column4: hi guys i have a question, i use to connect to my work pc with ssh and a password...so i have to insert the passphrase every single time....is there a way to store the passphrase somewhere so i have to insert it only the first time?
yeah i can walk you through it
another way is just to scp or whatever the id_rsa.pub over to server:~/.ssh
i have this error /usr/bin/ssh-copy-id: ERROR: No identities found
this would be the *nix way if the ubuntu way didn't work: http://www.linuxproblem.org/art_9.html
i dont have  ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub... i only have "known_host" in my ~/.ssh
then you didn't creat an rsa then, as user, ssh-keygen -t rsa
i read the link just now....i'll check it out
the rsa key was created by my boss
once you do that you will have a ~/.ssh with two files in it. id_rsa and id_rsa.put
ok then, point the ssh-copy-id to the right directory then
same error as before :  /usr/bin/ssh-copy-id: ERROR: No identities found
